text.p: The following are leading domestic stories in Portuguese newspapers.
* The government wants changes in the electoral laws ready by July 1998, so that they will be applicable in time for the next general elections.
* Agriculture Minister Gomes da Silva says the percentage of the active population engaged in agriculture will fall in the coming years.
* The Assistant Minister to the Prime Minister, Jorge Coelho, is seeking a replacement for Socialist Party parliamentary leader Jorge Lacao.
* Renault workers in Portugal not planning strike for now after announcement of stoppages by Renault workers elsewhere in Europe.
* Portuguese mobile phone operator Telecel may grow less in 1997 than in 1996 as competition is expected to stiffen, according to a study by Salomon Brothers.
* The Economy Ministry chose a consortium comprising Banco Chemical and Salomon Brothers to prepare the restructuring of the pulp and paper sector in Portugal, the paper learned.
